did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: National Civic Federation Howell-Barkley Bill Correspondence on Microfilm,
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Microfilm of National Civic Federation Howell-Barkley Bill Correspondence

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The National Civic Federation (NCF) was an American economic organization founded in 1900 which brought together chosen representatives of big business and organized labor, as well as consumer advocates to solve labor disputes.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: National Civic Federation Howell-Barkley Bill Correspondence on Microfilm #5650 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
